snippet: Manuel Osorio-Arellanes, who is from the Mexican state of Sinaloa, was convicted in the 2010 killing of the agent, Brian Terry, near the Arizona-Mexico border.
abstract: Manuel Osorio-Arellanes, man convicted in shooting death of Border Patrol agent Brian Terry during a firefight, is sentenced to 30 years in prison; incident revealed the government's botched gun-smuggling investigation known as Operation Fast and Furious.
lead_paragraph: Manuel Osorio-Arellanes, who is from the Mexican state of Sinaloa, was convicted in the 2010 killing of the agent, Brian Terry, near the Arizona-Mexico border.

headline.main: Arizona: Man Gets 30 Years in Case Tied to Fast and Furious
headline.print_headline: Arizona: Man Gets 30 Years in Case Tied to Fast and Furious
